problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the arc length of the ABC sector is 12.85 and the adjacent angles CBA and CBD are complementary, compute the length of the BC side of the ABC sector. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (10661.09, 6169.65)
B = (34.23, 34.23)
C = (34.23, 12305.079999999998)
D = (-2465.77, 4364.359999999999)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 8))

# Draw the purple arc
radius = 12305.079999999998
start_angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(A[1] - B[1], A[0] - B[0]))
end_angle = np.degrees(np.arctan2(C[1] - B[1], C[0] - B[0]))

if start_angle > end_angle:
    end_angle += 360

arc = patches.Wedge(
    center=B,
    r=radius,
    theta1=start_angle,
    theta2=end_angle,
    facecolor="purple",
    edgecolor="black",
    alpha=0.6
)
ax.add_patch(arc)

# Draw the line BD
ax.plot([B[0], D[0]], [B[1], D[1]], color='black', alpha=0.6)

# Draw the 30-degree angle marker
def draw_angle_marker(ax, center, p1, p2, radius, angle_text, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draws an angle marker and label.'''
    angle1 = np.arctan2(p1[1] - center[1], p1[0] - center[0])
    angle2 = np.arctan2(p2[1] - center[1], p2[0] - center[0])
    
    if angle2 < angle1:
        angle2 += 2 * np.pi

    theta = np.linspace(angle1, angle2, 100)
    x = center[0] + radius * np.cos(theta)
    y = center[1] + radius * np.sin(theta)
    ax.fill(x, y, color=color, alpha=alpha)

    # Add angle text
    mid_angle = (angle1 + angle2) / 2
    text_x = center[0] + (radius + 1) * np.cos(mid_angle)
    text_y = center[1] + (radius + 1) * np.sin(mid_angle)
    ax.text(text_x, text_y, angle_text, fontsize=14, ha="center", va="center")

draw_angle_marker(ax, B, C, D, radius=2, angle_text=r"$30^circ$")

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_xlim(-4965.77, 15034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-4965.77, 15034.23)
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The sum of the degrees of an angle and its complementary angle is 90. The CBA angle has a complementary angle with degree 30 so the degree of the CBA angle is 90 - 30 = 60. The CBA angle of the ABC sector is 60 and the arc length is 12.85 so the BC radius can be computed as $\frac{12.85}{\frac{60}{360} * (2 * \pi)} = \frac{12.85}{0.17 * (2 * \pi)} = \frac{12.85}{1.07}= 12.01$. Therefore the final answer is 12.01.
